Fields.DialogueText: Capitano, I just thought you might want to know that we're about to face a storm head on.
Excuse me?
A storm. One of those dark, loud things with all the wind and clouds. We're sailing into one.

Fields.MenuText: Can't we just go around it?
Why am I hearing about this now?
Oh... fun.

Fields.DialogueText: I mean, we could, but why bother when you have me?
I was going to tell you earlier, but you were busy. Besides, I have everything taken care of.
I'm glad you agree. It's nothing to worry about.
I wouldn't have even bothered telling you, but you are the capitano. This is the type of thing you should be aware of.
Thank... you?
*ALARM*
Is that an alarm for Morganas or for the storm?
Oh, darn, and here I was hoping to avoid them in the storm.
So that's why we were heading into potential disaster?
Yes, but now we'll have to wait until after the battle to lift my spirits.
@BATTLE
But you never know - a storm can suddenly arrive from the calm, or disappear just as unexpectedly... Exciting, isn't it?
EEEEEEeeeeeekkkk!
The hell was that?!
Capitano, grab a gun! Shoot it! Kill it!
Maestrale, what are you... get off that chair!
We have a vicious plague of unruly vermin on this ship, Capitano. We need to eradicate them this instant!

Fields.MenuText: That was a lot of awfully big words, Maestrale.
You saw a rat?
A vicious plague of vermin? And standing on a chair is going to help you with that?

Fields.DialogueText: Do I need to speak more slowly for you? Just grab your gun when I tell you to grab your gun!
You say that like it is nothing! This is a matter of life and death, Capitano...
It touched me, Capitano! Do you understand? I felt its grimy fur against my leg, and it was disgusting!
There it is! The pest is stalking me now!
It's one rat. We must've picked him up last time we hit port.
He's kind of cute, actually.
Cute? That thing? Are you crazy?
*ALARM*
There it goes...
Meno male! Grazie a Dio...
Come on, now. We have Morganas to deal with.
Uh, Capitano, I'm not setting foot on the deck until this infestation is dealt with.
Morganas take precedence, but permission granted for you to bring the chair with you.
Not funny, Capitano.
@BATTLE
Where you see one, be sure there are more. Haven't the Morganas taught us anything?
Enemy patrol spotted!
@BATTLE
Did I overhear a rumor about damage to the steam turbines? Give me a proper report.
Oh, uh, that's actually been... fixed.
Fixed? How? The initial gossip sounded like a ticket to a drydock overhaul.
Maestrale repurposed some of our supplies to apply a patch. May not be a permanent solution, but we're operational.
The solution was obvious! One look and I knew exactly what to do.

Fields.MenuText: Maybe we should reassign you to the engine room, Maestrale.
Don't pat your own back too hard, Maestrale.
Good job, Maestrale. Looks like you saved us again.

Fields.DialogueText: Oh, please don't. It's far too hot down here. I need to feel a nice breeze.
I'm not patting my back. All I did was save the day.
Oh, Capitano, you keep up that talk and you'll have me blushing in no time.
But let's not forget it is a temporary solution. I'll take care of it the next time we're in port, Capitano.
Right, let's go. No time to waste.
Looks like we've got more Morganas to harry us on our way to port!
@BATTLE
Ah, Maestrale. Here to deliver your after-action report?
Not yet. In fact, I have a question for you.
What is it?
What is with all these witless Morganas throwing themselves at us?

Fields.MenuText: Maybe they just find you irresistible.
Like you said, they're stupid.
It's what Morganas do. You can't be that surprised, can you?

Fields.DialogueText: Are you trying to be charming, Capitano? Please, feel free to continue.
I'd say they're more annoying than stupid.
I'm not surprised, but I am disappointed.
The last thing I want to do is waste my time fighting Morganas.
You don't want to fight Morganas? You want to let them roam free?
Well, no. I mean, I'd rather spend a nice day enjoying the sea, wouldn't you?
Sure, but we have a job to do. Rid the sea of Morganas first, then we can enjoy a little peace, right?
*sigh* When you say it like that, you make me feel bad.
Now where is our lovely Belle? She needs to hear this.
Ah! There you are, Maestrale.
I hope this is important. I was in the middle of something, Capitano.

Fields.MenuText: Well, if you don't want to hear about our new job, you can get back to whatever you were doing.
This is about our new assignment.
Everything I have to say is important.

Fields.DialogueText: Wait, we have a new job? I want all the details, dear Capitano.
That is important. I'm all ears.
I see someone's ego is more than healthy. Do I need to put you in your place?
We've been assigned to escort another warship.
Oh? You most certainly should've started with that. It's an ear catcher.
An ear catcher?
Well, it can't be an eye catcher, now can it? It's spoken word.
Fair point.
What else can you tell me, Capitano?
We're supposed to meet our charge in port, escort them safely along a predetermined track plan, and make sure they arrive at their destination in one piece.
Now that's a mission I can get behind.
I'm glad you approve.
*ALARM*
I don't approve of that.
Then let's dispatch them.
@BATTLE
You look rather chipper. Are you in a good mood?
Oh, you mean this smile? This little thing, right here? I'm just elated.
Are you going to tell me why?
I'm excited for our new assignment. This is the kind of thing I'm meant to do.

Fields.MenuText: It sounds kind of boring to me. A glorified babysitting mission.
I prefer bloody missions with massive forces and risk of death, personally.
A relaxing escort mission seems like a nice change.

Fields.DialogueText: Glorified babysitting? Then I suppose this war is just one big glamorized game of Marco Polo?
Ugh, I suppose there's no accounting for taste.
Relaxing? Have you not been paying attention to the waters lately? How about the storms we've been seeing?
*sigh* It's okay if you don't understand. I am a tad unique.
No, I mean, I get it. You're not the biggest fan of fighting Morganas.
That's an understatement if I've ever heard one.
*ALARM*
Speak of the devil.
They've always had horrible timing.
Let's just take care of them quickly so we can get to our assignment.
@BATTLE
Maestrale, I was hoping to go over our supplies while we were in port.
Already taken care of, Capitano.
What?
I sent an officer out to gather all the supplies we were low on and pick up everything else we'd need for our assignment.

Fields.MenuText: Next time check with me. I had some personal things I wanted to send for as well.
Taking initiative. I like it.
You're smarter than you look.

Fields.DialogueText: I took care of that too. Here's a copy of the list I sent the officer off with. See?
Well, clearly I like it too.
Hmmm, implying I don't look intelligent. What exactly are you saying, Capitano?
Hold that thought. I'm afraid we have company nearby.
Morganas?
I'm sensing their approach. We should ready ourselves. Quickly.
I'll get the crew back on board.
The bastards are always in the way.
@BATTLE
Keep it up and who knows where you'll end up.
What? How did you... this is a little disturbing. Can Belles read minds?
I feel like I've stepped into a trap.
That's the ship we're escorting? It's huge.
It's a battleship.
I know. It's just... goodness.

Fields.MenuText: It's certainly impressive.
I prefer our ship. It might not be as big, but it has plenty of personality.
Clearly someone is overcompensating.

Fields.DialogueText: You can color me impressed. And also a little frightened.
Pft, flatterer.
Heh heh, I like the thought of that. It paints this entire spectacle in a whole new light.
*ALARM*
Is that our alarm?
No, that's the battleship. It's drowning out our alarm.
Well, at least we'll get a chance to see this ship in action.
Though if this alarm gets any louder, we won't be able to hear it in action.
@BATTLE
It's nice to meet you, Capitano.
So you're to be our escort? You don't look like much.
Excuse me?

Fields.MenuText: Calm down, Maestrale. No need to start a fight.
No, excuse you. You might be bigger than us, but that doesn't mean you get to disrespect us.
Haven't you ever been told not to judge a book by its cover?

Fields.DialogueText: Oh, so now you want some of this? I don't like having you two team up on me.
That's right, Capitano. Show this gargantuan imbecile who's boss.
We're not a book, we're a ship. A ship with feelings and emotions that have been angered.
Ho ho, I like you. You have energy.
I'd say I have spirit.
Mmmm. I assume you've received our route.
Unfortunately, no. That didn't accompany the initial briefing.
Just like the Protection Force bureaucracy to forget such an important detail. I'll get it to you soon so we can leave within the hour.
The sooner we can be on our way, the better.
On that, we agree. Our route should be teeming with Morganas, so keep a wary eye.
If it's teeming with Morganas, why don't we take an alternate route? I'm sure I could draw one up in no time.
We have a battleship, little lady! The Morganas are the reason we're taking the route!
*sigh* I hope that means he'll do all the fighting.
I doubt you're that lucky. They'll probably sit back, out of sight, while we do the dirty work.
*groan*
@BATTLE
Is that what I think it is, Maestrale?
It's a storm, Capitano. I hope that's what you think it is. If not, there might be something wrong with your eyes.
I'm guessing our route will take us straight through?
And you said I wasn't that lucky.

Fields.MenuText: Quit your smiling. This is nothing to smile about.
It looks pretty violent. Think you can handle it?
A turbulent storm is nothing you can't handle, right?

Fields.DialogueText: I disagree. I mean, look at those beautiful clouds. Is there anything better than a good lightning strike in the distance? Answer? Yes. A lightning strike up close.
This is what I love to do. You won't find a better guide on the stormy seas.
Exactly. If anything, we'll be getting to our destination faster.
Honestly, I hope our giant charge can keep up.
We're going to have to hold their hands for a bit.
They're going to suck all the fun out of this, aren't they?
You're going to be thankful for them if we run into any Morganas in there.
They don't seem to help much.
*ALARM*
Speaking of which...
@BATTLE
You needed me, Capitano?
Yes, the captain of the battleship was asking for an ETA. I think he wants us to move faster.
He wants us to move faster? His stupid ship is the one holding us back.
Maestrale...
Does he even realize how ridiculous that idea is? That we're slowing him down? It's dumbfounding!
Maestrale, I...
I'm not usually one for violence, but there's just something about the sound of his voice when he's looking down on me that makes me want to strike him.

Fields.MenuText: Maestrale, just calm down for a second and let me get a word in!
Can you complain somewhere else?

Fields.DialogueText: Did you just raise your voice at me? I'm already ticked off. You don't want to get on my bad side.
Aren't you going to say something? You're just going to sit there and agree with him? My God, I can't believe you agree with him!
Oh, I'm the problem here? I'm being annoying now? Well, excuse me!
You know, you're worse than that idiot captaining the battleship. At least I don't have to see him every day.
*ALARM*
Oh, good! For once, I'm happy to fight some Morganas. I don't care if that stupid battleship helps or not!
What did I say?
@BATTLE
Capitano, there's another storm on the horizon. We're about to face some rough seas.
Again? It's like they plotted this course to try and sink our ships.
It's not bothering me.

Fields.MenuText: We should plot another course.
If it's not bothering you, then I'm sure we'll be fine.
What's with the attitude? Are you still angry?

Fields.DialogueText: Good luck with that. You won't have my help.
Nothing's bothering me. I'm totally fine.
Noooo, of course not. Why would I be angry with such a great capitano?
I knew it. You're still unhappy.
Mhmmmm.
Are you going to yell at me? Curse at me?
Give me the silent treatment?
*ALARM*
Duty calls.
I'm going to have to do something about that.
@BATTLE
Ah, finally out of the storm. It's nice to see the sky again.
I suppose.
Still with the cold shoulder?
*glare*

Fields.MenuText: I'm sorry?
Glaring? We've devolved to glaring?
I've never noticed how pretty your eyes are before.

Fields.DialogueText: No, you're not. If you were, there wouldn't be an interrogative tone at the end of your sentence.
I prefer to think of it as an evolution. It's better than ignoring you, isn't it?
Don't even try it, Capitano. I'm not in the mood.
*ALARM*
What's that?
We're surrounded. We have Morganas on all sides.
You couldn't have told me this earlier?
I didn't notice. I was paying too much attention to the storm.
You were also busy being angry at me.
That takes less effort than you'd think.
*BOOM*
Let's focus on the Morganas.
Finally, a wise word out of your mouth.
@BATTLE
Capitano, what do you want? Shouldn't you be in your office, captaining?
I was hoping we could talk.
What about? I don't have as much time to waste as you apparently do.

Fields.MenuText: I want to apologize. I don't want to stay at odds like we are.
I want to get over whatever the hell your problem with me is.
I'm wasting time? You're the one starting fights.

Fields.DialogueText: That's surprising. I wasn't expecting a real apology for at least another two days.
I don't have a problem with you. I just don't like dealing with you right now.
I'm not starting fights, but I'm not ending them either.
*sigh* You have a way of pissing me off sometimes, you know that?
I'm not trying to do so.
I've been told... I can be temperamental.
Nah... you?
I try not to be, but my emotions can get the better of me.
*ALARM*
No-good sea scum! Always popping up where they're not wanted!
Let's put those volatile emotions of yours to good use.
Hmph. Fine. I suppose a fight every now and then might do me good.
Exactly.
@BATTLE
That's our destination, right?
If I'm reading the charts correctly, it is.
Do the navigation charts show the swarm of Morganas hovering around the port?
What do you think?
I think if it did, we'd have a psychic map on our hands.

Fields.MenuText: Do you have a plan or not?
Maps and charts can't be psychic. You need a mind to be psychic.
I think I know what to do.

Fields.DialogueText: Oh, I have... something up my sleeve.
Don't dwell on the details. We have a predicament on our hands.
No, you don't. Leave this to me.
See those rocks on the other side of the Morganas?
The sharp, deadly-looking ones?
We're going to move through them to get the upper hand.
You're planning to lead a battleship through that?!
You say that like it's impossible.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
Morganas coming in fast!
@BATTLE
Bwahaha, I do love a good battle. When do you think the next wave is scheduled to arrive?
Ugh, I forgot how distasteful you are. I'd rather know where all these Morganas are coming from.

Fields.MenuText: That is a good question. I don't see any place for a large horde to hide.
Come on, Maestrale, get in the spirit of things! Smash Morganas and have a good time.
Honestly, all that can wait until after I get a good meal. I'm starving.

Fields.DialogueText: Exactly. They can't just be coming out of the aether.
I will not "smash and have a good time!" There is nothing you could do or say that will change my mind on this matter.
Thinking with your stomach? At a time like this? ... Actually, I could go for something to eat too, now that you mention it.
Oh, thank heavens. You're our reinforcements, correct?
Who else would we be? Ha ha ha ha!
Excellent. When are you heading into the storm to finish them off?
Excuse me?
The storm. That's where the Morganas have been coming from.
Oh, really?
There's that smile again.
This is going to be more fun than I thought.
Capitano, are we ready yet?
That is the third time you've asked me that.
I'm excited to go.
You're going to have to wait until we're all restocked, Maestrale.
What are you talking about? Our supplies are fine. I made sure of it before we headed out.
Our supplies are fine. The battleship's, on the other hand, are not. She takes a lot longer to load up.
Oh, I didn't think about that.

Fields.MenuText: Nobody is perfect.
Something to keep in mind for next time.
You should have.

Fields.DialogueText: Well, of course not, but I feel bad. I should've thought ahead.
Yes, of course. A battleship goes through supplies a lot faster than I thought it would.
You have a problem with the way I do things? I'd like to see you do all this on your own.
How much longer do you think it'll take until they're ready?
I'm not sure. You'd have to ask the captain.
I would rather not. I do not like that man.
I would never have guessed.
And we seem to have more important things to handle at the moment.
What do you mean?
Morganas adding a foul stink to the sea breeze.
The battleship isn't ready to engage. Let's drive them off ourselves.
I suppose that's better than sitting around doing nothing.
@BATTLE
Let's outmaneuver these Morganas!
@BATTLE
Maestrale, you were brilliant out there. Great work.
Grazie, Capitano!
You look a little shaken, though.
It may not have seemed like it to you, but that last combat was rough for me.

Fields.MenuText: We've had tougher fights.
That was pretty bad. We're lucky to be alive.
Chin up, Maestrale. We finished that handily.

Fields.DialogueText: If you say so, Capitano.
It's not luck, Capitano. We're skilled.
We must have different definitions of the word "handily."
If we fell to a couple of common Morgana grunts at this point, I'd die of embarrassment.
Or drowning, or multiple gunshots, explosions... or perhaps even getting eaten by Morganas? The possibilities are endless.
All I'm saying is that we're too good to be beaten at this point.
You're starting to sound cocky, Capitano.
It's confidence.
The difference between cockiness and confidence is the rise and fall of a civilization.
You're telling me to stay grounded?
More or less. Every fight could be our last, remember that.
Fair enough, but you can count on me to take every battle seriously.
Captain, what are you doing here? Did you need something?
I wanted to double check our supplies. It wouldn't do to run out of anything important as we ride into the eye of the storm.
You don't need to worry about that. We're not even close to running out of anything.
Really? Maestrale knew what she was doing?
She's also been making sure we don't waste what we have.
Which I wouldn't need to if this crew appreciated the value of our limited supplies!

Fields.MenuText: I don't waste supplies, and I expect my crew to avoid waste, too.
The way you're keeping us stocked makes it seem unlimited.
Oh, you want a new crew? Maybe the battleship is looking for a Belle.

Fields.DialogueText: We're all guilty of a little waste... but we have to do our best.
Keep shooting and eating like you are, and we'll see how long it lasts.
No, thank you. I'm actually quite happy where I am.
Was there a reason you were checking on our supplies, Capitano?
Just making sure.
Did I give you some reason to doubt me?
No, I just--
Molto bene, Capitano.
It seems like I'm always on her bad side.
You're not the only one, Captain. That stormy temperament...
@BATTLE
Into the eye we go!
It's going to take us a little more time to get to the eye, Maestrale.
It's still where we're headed!

Fields.MenuText: You're cute when you get excited.
You get excited over the oddest things.
Steady as she goes, then. To the eye!

Fields.DialogueText: I'm wh... that's... well, that's neither here nor there. We should be focusing on the storm.
One person's odd is another person's beautiful.
To the eye! This is going to be fun.
*ALARM*
Oh, great. Here to ruin my fun once again.
That's one more reason to destroy them.
One more reason to hate them, you mean.
There's that look in your eye again.
What look?!
The one that makes me too afraid to explain the look to you.
@BATTLE
We're deep in the storm now. How do you even know we're heading to the heart of it?
This is where I thrive, Capitano. You might feel fear, but I feel alive.

Fields.MenuText: It doesn't scare me. I don't get scared.
As long as I have you, I'm confident we'll make it through.
I actually like it. I've always loved storms.

Fields.DialogueText: We all get scared. Me, I hate rats and insects. Ugh, just thinking of them sends shivers down my spine.
Well, I promise not to disappoint.
Me, too. I'll take the dark beauty of the rain over the boring shine of the sun any day.
So... storms really don't frighten you at all?
The sun hidden by black clouds, cloaked in darkness, and surrounded on all sides by hidden enemies? Let's just say I know how Julius Caesar felt.
*ALARM*
Let's hope our story has a happier ending.
I don't plan on dying any time soon.
@BATTLE
I'm still freezing. That rain soaked me to the core.
I'm sure we have jackets if you need one, Capitano.
You're not wearing one.
I'm fine.
You know, you seem impervious to the cold.
What do you mean?

Fields.MenuText: You're looking hot.
Bundled up like that, you must hardly notice the chill in the air.
I wish I had a nice jacket like that.

Fields.DialogueText: Oh? Grazie, Capitano! Though I'm feeling fairly cold right now.
Oh, I notice it. I'm just not letting it bother me.
I told you, there are jackets inside. If you grab one, get one for me too.
So, does your clothing not help you that much?
You might not be able to notice, but this material is very absorbent.
What, really?
Yes. A few minutes in the rain like this and my clothes double in weight.
But you've been out here since we ventured into the storm.
I know. I can hardly move.
Really?
It's not a problem. I'm fine where I am. I hope we don't run into many more Morganas. I'd like to get this over with as soon as possible.
I guess even you have a limit to how much of a storm you can take.
I'm only a Belle, after all.
@BATTLE
Capitano, we have Morganas approaching!
Not to mention a huge wave!
What?!
*CRASH*
@BATTLE
*pant* Are you all right, Capitano?
I'm fine, but good grief. That freak wave soaked me good.
Not only us, the battleship too.

Fields.MenuText: Making any shady repairs that you haven't told me about?
Are we taking on water. If so, we're in trouble...
Think we can limp to the finish line?

Fields.DialogueText: I did better than that. I brought actual repair supplies.
Not as long as I'm here. I can put together something to fix us up.
We won't have to limp if I have anything to say about it.
It won't take long to catch our breath, Capitano.
Take as many moments as you'd like. Just get us moving again.
Aye aye, Capitano. Right away.
Seas have been extra choppy around here, Capitano!
That must be the Morganas responsible for the attacks.
A connection... I think somehow they're also responsible for the storm.

Fields.MenuText: Was your first clue the lightning it's shooting into the sky, or the evil eyes?
You think Morganas can create a storm?
One more reason to destroy them, then.

Fields.DialogueText: The lightning. Though now that you mention it, those eyes do just scream "storm," don't they?
We don't know everything that Morganas are capable of.
For you, maybe. I just want to see if I can learn how she's doing it.
Damn! What's that idiot captain think he's doing!?
Sailing a battleship directly into battle. I don't think he's capable of much higher thought.
Well, he's surrounded now. There are Morganas pulling in behind him.
I can see that.
And now we go to his rescue. Time to clear a path through all of these Morganas to help them out.
Do we have to?
Maestrale. Our mission is to see them safely through, in case you forgot.
I know, I know. Let's hurry.
@BATTLE
Ha, that wasn't so tough! I was expecting something a little stronger!
It was only so easy because you had us to--
(Maestrale, just let it go. We don't have to deal with him any more after this.)
(Hmm, you make a good point.)
You know, I thought the storm would fade away after we dispatched that little thunderbug.
Maybe it will if we just wait a while.
I'm glad it seems to still be going strong.
So we'll just wait here until the clouds pass?
Or I could just lead us out again. It sounds like fun.
It sounds dangerous. But ultimately I'll listen to your decision. What do you think, Captain?

Fields.MenuText: I think we should play it safe and wait.
I trust Maestrale. I'm sure she'll have us in port before we know it.

Fields.DialogueText: Oh, you're no fun. If we're just going to sit here and wait, I'll head down and read for a bit. Let me know when you're ready for more!
That's what I like to hear! Everybody grab your jackets and buckle up. This might get a little bumpy!
Psst! Maestrale, a moment?
What is it, Capitano?
